full_threads.body: Perfect thanks Joel!

Hi guys!

Just wondering if you had a solution for the below issue?

Thanks!

Theo

Hi Theo,

All good now, we have updated the paddings. It should be working fine now.
https://belance.com.au/grooms/

Hi Theo,

Got it! Thanks for the video. I'll work on it right now. It seems that you are on the header. Would it be ok If I take over?

Sorry to be a pain, but think maybe wasn't clear.

I've done a video here: https://www.loom.com/share/ed0f47520ed54a9f8fff33edb53a13eb

Thanks!

Hi Theo,

Sure, all good now. 
I have included the Post Title as well. 
https://belance.com.au/groom-test-header/

Let me know if this works for you?

Sorry Joel I meant the vertical distance/gap between the menu item and the line below. See screenshot.

The horizontal distance was fine as before, please revert back to that.

Thanks,

Theo

Hi Theo,

Sure, all good now. We have updated the Header - Groom. 
https://belance.com.au/groom-test-header/

Thanks Joel!

Would you mind letting me know how we can change the following?

1. How to change/reduce the gap between the menu name and the underline below? See screenshot below, seems a bit far away/disproportionate.



2. Also, where can we reduce the length of that underline?

3. When the sub-heading "CURATED RESOURCES FOR THE GROOM THAT CARES" disappears, is there a way to make it smoother? It just feels very instant/quick.

Thanks!

Theo

Hi Theo,

Yes, it should be working fine when you preview the page. This usually happens when you resize your browser. Let me know if this works for you?

Thanks Heath, looks good!

Just noticed the following when scrolling down in elementor - see attached. Is it fully centered?

Hi Theo,

We have made some changes on the site. Please see below:
- We have created a test post (https://belance.com.au/groom-test-header/) currently set on private
- To set the header to "Groom Journal" set the category to "Grooms Journal" then the header "Grooms Journal" settings will kick in. 

Let me know if this works for you?
Great thank you Heath!

Hi Theo, 

Apologies for the delay. Yes this should be fine and within the 2 hours quoted. 

We will action Thursday/Friday and let you know when ready to review.

action.text: Rica Rosario Valencia assigned to Heath Maguire

full_threads.body:
Hi Heath,

Hope you're well!

Just wanted to check and see if you had received this?

When could we look at having it done?

Many thanks,

Theo


On Sat, 10 Jul 2021 at 14:49, Theodore English <theo@belance.com.au> wrote:
Hi Heath,

Okay, so we've confirmed the things we need done:

1) Remove section when scrolling down.

When scrolling down, can we make this section disappear?



2) Mobile

Current Layout



WHAT WE NEED

- When scrolling down only the section "THE GROOM JOURNAL" stays sticky similar to this:



So the main header stays the same at the top so people can always easily navigate to the main website but the title/header "THE GROOM JOURNAL" collapses and has an arrow on the right for the menu options and stays sticky throughout the blog.

3) Now we need to make two types of blogs:

a) THE GROOMS JOURNAL: this will have content specific to wedding and grooms only
b) THE BLOG (This is our regular blog and won't' change (https://belance.com.au/journal/): this will have general content not related to weddings

The changes in the menu will only apply to the section "THE GROOMS JOURNAL", so when people are viewing any articles that are within the category "THE GROOMS JOURNAL" they will see the updated navigation. If they are viewing an article that is within the normal blog (https://belance.com.au/journal/), they will just see it now - no changes to that.

So when we write an article we can just choose whether it is part of our BLOG or GROOMS JOURNAL and that will apply the settings and be published to the relevant section.

Hope that makes sense?

Let me know if you need any further clarifications or info.

Thanks Heath!

Theo



On Wed, 7 Jul 2021 at 12:06, Theodore English <theo@belance.com.au> wrote:
Hi Heath,

Thanks for letting me know!

That's a good point, I think for mobile it's fine because we will keep the main header and menu for people to navigate to. I think we can add options for people to easily find and navigate to the main section at all times if they want to learn about our tailoring service.

Let me come back to you with my decision before we do anything but good to know will be within 2hrs.

Cheers,

Theo


On Wed, 7 Jul 2021 at 09:15, Heath Maguire <heath@wolfiq.com.au> wrote:
Hi Theo,

Thanks for the video. We can make these updates for you. It will be 2 hours of dev time.

I understand the reason for the simplified menu when in this section of the site, but, if people are landing directly in this area, it does make it harder for them to get over the catalogue/product section of the website. I.e. they have to go 'hunting' to find their way over to the products and people are inherently lazy and have short attention spans online. I'm fine to implement it for you, just want to make sure I'm giving you the full picture. You can counter act some of this loss by having plenty of in text hyperlinks directly to products.

Let me know? Thanks,

Heath Maguire
CREATIVE DIRECTOR

Phone: 1300 072 134
Mobile: 0415 162 271
Email: heath@wolfiq.com.au
